news_header: Sri Lankan president Anura Kumara Dissanayake on the verge of a snap election and appoints Harini Amarasuriya as the new prime minister.
news_text: Sri Lanka's new president, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has dissolved parliament to hold a snap general election on November 14, nearly a year early. Dissanayake, who recently won the presidential election, aims to seek a fresh mandate for his policies. He appointed Harini Amarasuriya as prime minister, marking the third time a woman has held this position in the country. Dissanayake faces the challenge of renegotiating a $2.9 billion IMF bailout deal amid ongoing economic hardships.
